channel.title: Parents
channel.description:
Ok, so I know there is a debate thread on the other section about this, but I want to discuss my current status with my mom.
Ok, so my dad is currently in Japan for another 9 days and I am watching his house. My mom is one of the over protecting, nagging moms who love blah blah blah. I understand my mom's point of view, but I just can't stand her. So my mom wants me to spend time at her house, but I can't because I have responsibilities at my dad's house I have to take care of in the mornings and nights.
So she comes over tonight and told me pack your stuff and lets go. I said no. She talked to her boy friend over the phone and he reccomended going to the police department to tell them. I did the research and discovered as long as I permission from my father to be here, know what to do in an emergency, feel safe and am safe then I am fine. Not only that, but I am nearly 17. I know this is the typical teenage rebellion moment, but I am calling out to someone who has been through this before. I don't want emancipation from my parents, I just don't want my mom to be in my life anymore. She said she'd be happy to sign me over to my dad once he gets back, but until then we're stuck together. She is scared that if the state finds her guilty of neglect of abandonment that she is going to lose her career. I honestly am not that mean to put her career in danger, but how do i make it through this next 9 days of hell?
The police said I have to call her every morning and night and stay out of trouble. First of all i have no criminal record so I don't know where that came from and why the hell call her.

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

It is better that your mum cares then her not caring at all, just try do what the police said until your father gets home so that you don’t cause any trouble between the two of you.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Fails:

My mom always assumes i’m on drugs.

Probably because you are.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

My mom always assumes i’m on drugs.

[quote=“Nebulae, post:5, topic:460370”]Well first of all her boyfriend sounds like an idiot for suggest phoning the police.

It’s nice to hear you still respect your mum even though you don’t want her in your life anymore.[/quote]
Couldn’t of said it any better. Spoken like a champ.

So, you can be 16 and ‘live’ alone? Where I live, you must be 17 with parent consent.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Nebulae, post:5, topic:460370”]What is her boyfriend like?[/quote]He is spoken for sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @Nebulae Nebulae
item.description:
@Nebulae wrote:

Well first of all her boyfriend sounds like an idiot for suggest phoning the police.

It’s nice to hear you still respect your mum even though you don’t want her in your life anymore. I say just stand your ground, although if she wants to hand you over to your dad then why is she still chasing you? Seems like things run a bit deeper. Have you tried expressing your feelings and asking her if there’s anything else on her mind that she’s not telling you?

What is her boyfriend like?

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

Well I never had this problem, my mom generally didn’t care(I.E me punching glass) so yeah XD

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Krackkid, post:2, topic:460370”]Seems find to me, you should check in when you’re on your own. Its just normal to do to make sure everything is going ok o.o[/quote]Yea, but when you have your mom’s phone number blocked through like 6 different apps its hard to.

I know I am over reacting. I guess I just need to calm down.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

Seems find to me, you should check in when you’re on your own. Its just normal to do to make sure everything is going ok o.o

Read full topic
